comments.body:
Removes the duplicate label from the holding libraries when the library name and the location name are the same. 

![Screen Shot 2021-03-17 at 8 39 15 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/111556449-05928d00-8761-11eb-948e-1b961941bcd4.png)

I noticed that the code 'warf' is not included in Alma::Location. Based on the template we use in production it refers to 'Western Americana: Reference Collection (WARF)'. @kevinreiss @mzelesky does this code need to be added in Alma? Or has it been replaced with another location code?

Orangelight search results with no duplicate label for the library.

![Screen Shot 2021-03-17 at 10 25 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/111564254-ccade480-876f-11eb-9e83-fc65117f67d8.png)

In the checkin we said to remove the tmpl files and keep only the .rb files. After looking into this I rejected it as an option. I'm quoting my note from slack `I kept solid only the holding_library.tmpl file so that we don’t need to generate it every time.
I rejected the idea of using the .rb files that we generate through the #generate method because they are being generated by retrieving data from the tables. With that said every time you start lando and you generate the .rb files using the tables from the database the tables would be empty and the generated .rb files would be empty.  Unless you also call the alma api every time you start lando so that you populate the tables.  We don’t want to call the alma api every time we run the app in development or test. So it is better to keep the tmpl files and use them through the #generate_from_templates method so that we will create the .rb files locally in case they don’t exist`.
Also this Pr addresses the removal of the double label in the orangelight display and updates the Location::Holdings table in bibdata. It also improves the code by removing unused lines of code and the generation of a nil file. 

If we want to improve the way we generate the locations this should be part of a new issue.

pulfalight.title: When a previously published collection is unpublished, it should be deleted from SOLR.
Display full location information for oversize items on record page (cabinet, drawer, folder)

comments.body: Thanks, @ccleeton. This may already be known, but the issue is that location info that had previously been public (like folder, cabinet, etc.) as well as location info that had been internal (like compartment letters and sections within compartments)--the data were in separate sections of EADs-- were both added to the same notes field in ASpace since that is seemingly the only place these text notes could go. I'll check in with ADAPT, but if PS is ok with this info displaying on the site, then it's probably fine? One question: you mention that staff write the location on call slips. All of this info will be automatically routed to Aeon/call slips, right?

@faithc for Mudd things we tend to write the floor/range/shelve info for easier reshelving. Not sure how much this will be needed with the way we plan to put the collections back into the building. That would not be in Apace so it would not appear on the call slip nor do we intend it to. If Firestone locations print then staff would not need to write it on there.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/38033024/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/38033024)

Coverage remained the same at 100.0% when pulling **b02bc6bf83876880fd829c545fde58a525874c21 on 917-gbl-3.3** into **5809f77d8827f494d032040cdf576b19a78d4378 on main**.
